content:
Hi :smile:
I wonder what the implications are of having a "normal" email address as a "noreply" address for Zulip? (Required by our provider for mass mail distribution.)

We do just use a normal Mailbox with Zulip. If thats what you are meaning.
You can even configure the incoming Mail integration, which allows replying to mails

@Robert there's no real cost, especially if you configure the relevant address with a vacation autoresponder or something. The main thing is that if you reply to emails sent from a noreply@ reply address, some of those contain confirmation links or other sensitive information that you generally don't want users forwarding to other users without understanding the implications.
